title: Desmond Tutu’s Message of Gratitude
sub_head: Americans backed his country’s freedom and got thanks in 2010.
body:
Archbishop Desmond Mpilo Tutu visited Christ Church in Greenwich, Conn., in June 2010 and treated parishioners to a master class in the art of African storytelling. An hour felt like minutes as he held scores of listeners in his hand.
Tutu, who died Sunday at 90, said it was “actually quite wonderful watching yourself growing old.” Little things one used to do without a thought, like standing up, become challenging. “Now,” he said, “I have to have a discussion with my body: ‘What do you think if we both get up now?’ And quite frequently you have a revolt.”
